text: Yep, got it!

text: Decision expected by the end of June

text: Want to get an update as soon as the Supreme Court decides Curtis Flowers’ case? Sign up for our email list! ⁦@InTheDarkAPM⁩

text: Decision is expected by the end of June
author: madeleinebaran

text: Editorial published in today’s Greenwood Commonwealth, local paper in Greenwood, MS — “We don’t know whether Flowers is guilty of this horrible crime ... The only way to resolve that doubt, if it can be resolved, may be for someone else to take over.” ⁦@InTheDarkAPM⁩
author: madeleinebaran

text: Front page of the latest Winona Times, the local paper in Winona, Mississippi. @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: NYT editorial “Justice Thomas’s line of inquiry misses that the real outrage of Mr. Flowers’s many trials,which the podcast ‘In the Dark’ has chronicled in painstaking detail, is the clear racism that has visited the jury selection process from the start.”
author: madeleinebaran

text: Expected by the end of June

text: Most likely by the end of the Court’s term, which is end of June
author: madeleinebaran

text: Signing off for the night! What a day. Looking forward to bringing you an in-depth episode of @InTheDarkAPM early next week where we take you inside #SCOTUS and analyze what happened in oral arguments in the Flowers case.
author: madeleinebaran

text: I’ll be on @NewsHour this evening around 6:27pm EST to talk about the Flowers case @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: #SCOTUS has posted the transcript of today’s oral argument in the case of Curtis Flowers @InTheDarkAPM https://www.supremecourt.gov/oral_arguments/argument_transcripts/2018/17-9572_2c83.pdf …
author: madeleinebaran

text: The lawyers for both sides & justices across the liberal-conservative spectrum agreed that the history of the prosecutor matters. Many justices were struck that it was the same prosecutor who tried the case 6 times and that there had already been 2 Batson violations in the case.
author: madeleinebaran

text: Justice Breyer appeared quite favorable to Flowers. Breyer went through the record of Evans striking black jurors in the six trials. Then he said, “I don’t think it’s going to take much once you have that background.” @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: Jason Davis, representing the state for the MS Attorney General Office told the Court, “The history in this case is troubling,” but he said Evans’ strikes were not about race. “The strikes in this case are supported by the record.” @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: Chief Justice Roberts said, “The case is unusual because you have the extensive history. I think that’s probably why the case is here for review.” @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: Justice Thomas asked a question! He asked about the defense’s strikes in trial 6 and the race of the jurors struck by the defense. Attorney Sheri Lynn Johnson said defense strikes were all against white jurors but that that wasn’t an issue raised
author: madeleinebaran

text: Justice Kavanaugh emphasized importance of Batson to the community’s confidence in the criminal justice system.
author: madeleinebaran

text: Oral arguments just ended. Many questions about the alleged disparate questioning of jurors by Evans.
author: madeleinebaran

text: More than 200 people in line this morning for oral arguments in the Flowers case. @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: Thank you so much, Myra!
author: madeleinebaran

text: Tweeting this again in case anyone missed it the first time.
author: madeleinebaran

text: Thank you so much for your support!
author: madeleinebaran

text: People from around the country are gathering in D.C. tomorrow to hear oral arguments in the Flowers’ case. Some people are even bringing signs and “Free Curtis” t-shirts.
author: madeleinebaran

text: Yes!
author: madeleinebaran

text: We’re going to be too busy reporting to have a meetup, unfortunately
author: madeleinebaran

text: People who are going to SCOTUS tomorrow for the Flowers’ oral arguments, get there EARLY. Like 5am early or earlier. I wouldn’t want anyone to miss out. @InTheDarkAPM
author: madeleinebaran

text: We can’t record it ourselves, but the Court records it. They’ll release the audio a few days later, and then we’ll release an episode soon after that. We’ll also be reporting on it same-day on our website. And I’ll tweet updates once it’s over.
author: madeleinebaran
